intro: Dendroviguiera quinqueradiata, commonly known as the five-rayed dendroviguiera, is a climbing shrub native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, moist environments. Its botanical structure makes it a subject of interest in both horticultural and ecological studies.
